title: Scaling Distributed Systems with Event-Driven Architecture
description: Explore the principles of event-driven design to build resilient and scalable microservices. This talk covers message brokers, eventual consistency, and real-world patterns used at scale.

title: Modern Frontend Performance: Beyond the Lighthouse Score
description: Deep dive into browser rendering pipelines, Web Vitals, and advanced optimization techniques to provide a buttery-smooth user experience.

title: Securing Your CI/CD Pipelines in a Zero-Trust World
description: Learn how to implement security as code. We will discuss supply chain attacks, automated vulnerability scanning, and managing secrets securely in automated workflows.

title: The Future of AI: Integrating LLMs into Production Applications
description: Moving past the hype: practical strategies for deploying Large Language Models. Focus on prompt engineering, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and monitoring AI performance.

title: Rust for JavaScript Developers: Bridging the Gap
description: Discover why Rust is becoming a favorite for web tooling. This talk introduces Rust syntax through the lens of JS and explores how WebAssembly is changing web development.

title: Database Deep Dive: Choosing Between SQL, NoSQL, and NewSQL
description: An analytical comparison of modern data storage solutions. Understand the trade-offs in CAP theorem, ACID compliance, and horizontal vs. vertical scaling.
